title: How Mizzou beats A&M, the biggest Big 12 game in years, a test for Oregon, and more
content: A top-10 meeting in Lubbock, an upset bid in Iowa City and a pair of SEC tests headline the weekend slate.

title: 'Give me a call, bro': How Texas Tech changed its fortunes with a $7M defensive line
content: The nation's leader in sacks is just the tip of the spear when it comes to the Red Raiders' work in the portal.

title: Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Parsons reflects on loss of ex-teammate Kneeland
content: Packers star Micah Parsons spent time Friday remembering and reflecting on the death of Marshawn Kneeland, his former teammate with the Cowboys, who died Thursday from a self-inflicted gunshot, according to authorities.

title: 49ers to again start QB Jones; Purdy 'further along'
content: While quarterback Brock Purdy slowly works his way back from injury, the 49ers will once again turn to Mac Jones as the starter for Sunday's NFC West showdown against the Rams.

title: Mark Sanchez won't return as Fox Sports analyst
content: Mark Sanchez will not return as a Fox Sports analyst as the former NFL quarterback faces trial stemming from his alleged attack on a truck driver last month.

title: NCAA: Six hoops players banned for betting plots
content: Six former men's college basketball players at New Orleans, Mississippi Valley State and Arizona State participated in gambling schemes that included game manipulation or sharing information with known bettors, the NCAA announced.

title: Raiders fire special teams coordinator McMahon
content: The Raiders have fired special teams coordinator Tom McMahon. He was in his fourth season with Las Vegas, but the unit has struggled this year.

title: Nets' Thomas (hamstring) out at least 3-4 weeks
content: Cam Thomas will miss at least the next three to four weeks with a left hamstring strain, the Nets announced Friday.

title: üèÄ Latest NBA intel on futures of Ja, Zion, Trae
content: How close are the Grizz, Pelicans and Hawks to trading their stars? Is Giannis Watch over? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst have the latest.

title: High expectations, mixed results: Why North Carolina is entering a pivotal season
content: The Tar Heels' prestigious past can't guarantee a prestigious future. Here's what that means for their season.

title: 15 NFL experts, 15 midseason predictions: We made our best calls for tight playoff races, more
content: Can the Bucs reach the Super Bowl? Will Myles Garrett win DPOY? We asked 15 experts to give their predictions for the rest of the NFL season.

title: How the Jets, trying to overturn years of misery, made franchise-altering moves in less than two hours
content: With much of the Jets organization at Nick Mangold's funeral, a pair of big trades were in the works 2 miles away.

content: A trip to Sombor, Serbia, paints a portrait of the elusive Nuggets star by the people who know him best.

title: Early takeaways: Hidalgo is Notre Dame's singular star, UConn can run it back
content: UConn? As good as expected. Tennessee? Still chasing elite status. And Notre Dame? Heavily reliant on Hannah Hidalgo.

title: Close race for No. 1 between bantamweight, welterweight
content: Two former champions will go for their second titles at UFC 322, giving their new divisions extra firepower.

title: Mick Schumacher can rewrite his story with IndyCar legacy team
content: Mick Schumacher's too-brief F1 career unceremoniously ended in 2022, but his desire for open-wheel fulfillment may yet lead him to IndyCar in 2026.

title: The good, the bad and the ugly: Are Liverpool back to their best?
content: Liverpool have looked like both world beaters and distant also-rans in 2025-26, but after a tumultuous summer, the Reds may have just turned a corner.

content: The woes of last season are starting to fade, but a clash with Liverpool will show whether City can contend.

content: Can anyone get past Sinner and Alcaraz? Will Djokovic play? Everything to know as the ATP Finals begin Sunday.

title: Lando Norris on pole in sprint qualifying
content: Lando Norris took pole position for Brazil's sprint race in what he will hope will be a weekend he takes a stranglehold on the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

content: Can Vergil Ortiz Jr. win his first world title? Will Erickson Lubin test Ortiz and finally win the "big fight"?

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list.

content: Our experts dive in to the lines and player props that offer value for Week 10, and share their tips and bets.

title: Want Wemby or Trey Murphy III? Now is the time to shoot your shot
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eye move for Liverpool's Konat√©
content: Bayern Munich are looking at a possible move for Liverpool's Ibrahima Konat√©. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple‚Äôs CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: Musk to Tesla shareholders: May be, we will do something with Intel
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed the company is developing its fifth-generation AI chip, AI5, for self-driving systems and is considering collaboration with Intel. Musk also mentioned Tesla might build a "gigantic chip fab" due to supplier limitations, with AI5 production slated for 2026 and AI6 for 2028. This announcement followed shareholder approval of Musk's substantial pay package.

title: Google‚Äôs AI investment: Company may bet ‚Äòbig‚Äô on Anthropic; equalise fight with OpenAI
content: Google is reportedly in early discussions for a major investment in Anthropic. This move escalates the global AI race, putting pressure on Microsoft-backed OpenAI. The potential funding could value Anthropic at over $350 billion. Google's strategic push aims to provide Anthropic with crucial resources to compete effectively in the evolving AI landscape.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo injury update: Will Bucks star play tonight vs Bulls?
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo will play for the Milwaukee Bucks against the Chicago Bulls.  This is a boost for the Bucks ahead of their NBA Cup game.  Antetokounmpo was dealing with knee soreness but is now off the injury list.  The Bulls are currently leading the Eastern Conference.  This game is important for both teams.  Fans can watch the match live.

title: Bihar polls: Record turnout triggers guessing game ‚Äî will it help or hurt Nitish?
content: Bihar's first phase saw record voter turnout, sparking debate on whether it favors the incumbent Nitish Kumar or signals anti-incumbency. Both NDA and Mahagathbandhan claim the surge benefits them. Historical trends suggest high turnout often indicates a regime change, but analysts point to recent government schemes potentially aiding the NDA.

title: Pak-Afghan tensions: Islamabad says truce talks collapse; fate of ceasefire unclear
content: Pakistan's defence minister has declared talks with Afghanistan have effectively collapsed. This comes after negotiators failed to bridge significant gaps. Weeks of border fighting have led to casualties on both sides. Qatar mediated a ceasefire, but sporadic clashes continue. The long-standing dispute over the Durand Line border remains a core issue.

title: Marshawn Kneeland death: Darius Slay‚Äôs wife Jennifer shares emotional plea
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, 24, died by self-inflicted gunshot wound days after scoring his first NFL touchdown. His death followed a brief police pursuit. The tragedy has prompted widespread grief and calls for greater mental health awareness in the NFL, with many teammates and public figures sharing their sorrow and support.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
content: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen says prioritizing Tom Brady took a toll: ‚ÄúLove isn‚Äôt a jail
content: Supermodel Gisele B√ºndchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. B√ºndchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: Mamdani‚Äôs rise throws up immigrants fear vs affordability crisis debate in MAGA world
content: New York City's political landscape is electrified by Zohran Mamdani's stunning mayoral victory, sparking contrasting reactions from MAGA supporters and progressives. While some fear a leftist takeover, others see Mamdani's win as a catalyst for addressing affordability, a theme even Donald Trump is now acknowledging, signaling a potential shift in political discourse.

title: Cricket in LA28: ICC reveals number of teams for men's and women's events
content: Cricket will make its return to the Olympic Games at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, featuring both men's and women's T20 tournaments. Each division will consist of six teams competing in a total of 28 matches, with 90 athlete quotas allocated per gender. This historic inclusion marks cricket's first Olympic appearance in 128 years.

title: 'Can't live with them anymore': Telangana woman kills self over fear of ants
content: A 25-year-old woman in Sangareddy district allegedly died by suicide due to a severe childhood fear of ants. She reportedly took the extreme step after noticing ants while cleaning her home. Her husband discovered her after returning from work, and a suicide note was found.

title: Taylor Swift Grammy 2026: Did she make the list amid Kelce wedding buzz?
content: Taylor Swift's latest album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' released October 3, 2025, is ineligible for the 2026 Grammy Awards due to the eligibility period. Fans are disappointed, but Swift is reportedly focused on wedding plans with Travis Kelce. She recently explained her absence from the Super Bowl Halftime show, citing her dedication to Kelce's demanding NFL career.

title: Immigration crackdown: Canada tightens visa rules; over 5L Indian students under lens
content: Canada has updated immigration guidelines, empowering officers to cancel already-issued visitor visas, study permits, and work permits. This shift emphasizes ongoing compliance with immigration conditions, impacting international students and frequent visitors. The changes aim to strengthen oversight and prevent program misuse.

title: Mega defence deal: India inks $1bn pact with US firm GE for 113 fighter jet engines
content: India's HAL has secured a significant $1 billion deal with GE for 113 jet engines for its LCA Mk1A fighter jets, ensuring timely deliveries.  Additionally, HAL is partnering with Russia's UAC to manufacture the SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in India, marking a major step towards self-reliance in civil aviation and boosting regional connectivity.

title: 'Situation normal soon': Delhi airport glitch fixed; backlog continues, 800 flights impacted
content: A technical glitch in Delhi airport's air traffic control messaging system (AMSS) disrupted over 800 flights, causing significant delays and at least 20 cancellations. The system failure forced air traffic controllers to switch to manual procedures, impacting flight-plan distribution and leading to extended wait times for passengers.

title: Michael Porter Jr & Sophie Cunningham spark dating rumors with viral post
content: Recent viral rumors falsely linked NBA star Michael Porter Jr. and WNBA player Sophie Cunningham romantically. The speculation stemmed from a parody account, despite the two being lifelong friends from the same hometown. Porter Jr. has previously faced criticism for his comments on women's basketball, and his mention of Cunningham appears to be an attempt to mend fences.

title: 'Mamu Gang' mastermind arrested: Delhi Police nab fruit seller who led bank robberies
content: Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested Kamrul alias Mamu, a 51-year-old fruit seller, who masterminded the "Mamu Gang" involved in interstate bank burglaries. Posing as a humble vendor by day, he meticulously planned heists, striking at night with precision to disable alarms and break into vaults. His arrest has solved three major bank burglary cases in Karnataka.

title: 'Sachin sir called before the final': Harmanpreet Kaur
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur revealed Sachin Tendulkar's pre-match advice helped her team stay grounded before their historic World Cup triumph.  She described the "world champion" feeling as surreal, crediting key players like Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma, and Shafali Verma for their pivotal roles in the victory. The magnitude of the achievement is still sinking in for the captain.

title: 'Some kind of idiot': Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath on MBA students; claims 'colleges are dead'
content: Nikhil Kamath, co-founder of Zerodha, believes traditional colleges are obsolete. He argues that online platforms and AI offer superior learning to MBA programs. Kamath suggests that formal degrees are becoming less relevant as companies like Meta and Apple shift focus from qualifications to practical skills. Vocational training is expected to gain prominence.

title: Baba Siddique murder: Wife moves Bombay HC, alleges builder-politician nexus, seeks SIT probe
content: Petition accuses Maharashtra police of shielding politically connected developers in slum redevelopment schemes; demands court-monitored SIT or probe by independent agency.¬†

title: Breaking boundaries: The changing reality of Indian women‚Äôs cricket
content: Over the last few years, more girls and women across India are playing cricket professionally, inspired by the tremendous growth of the game. India‚Äôs victory in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup in early November has inspired many more budding players. Mehul Malpani, Amol Yashwant Karhadkar, Y.B. Sarangi, and Suruchi Kumari report on the changing reality of Indian women‚Äôs cricket

content: The Chief Minister announced that from November 9, the State government will begin procurement of groundnut, moong, urad, and soybean from farmers at minimum support prices

title: HAL inks $1-billion deal with GE Aerospace for 113 jet engines to power Tejas fighters
content: The delivery of engines will begin from 2027, and the supplies will have to be completed by 2032, officials said; the deal comes despite the downturn in the India-U.S. ties over tariffs

content: Farmers will now get ‚Çπ3,300 per tonne (excluding harvesting and transportation cost) against the FRP of ‚Çπ3,200 fixed by the Centre. State government and sugar mills will contribute ‚Çπ50 each

content: An electoral roll that has been intensely revised must be accepted, and political parties and the Election Commission should focus on upholding the trust of the Indian voter

content: If a song penned by Tagore 66 years before the birth of Bangladesh can be objectionable, the same yardstick should be applied to Sindh mentioned in the Indian national anthem, says expert

content: A new book titled Homecoming: Mental Health Journeys of Resilience, Healing and Wholeness was launched in the city on Friday

title: RJD candidate booked for 'threatening' security personnel during polling in Bihar
content: The RJD leader was accused of misbehaving with a security personnel when he was assisting an elderly woman to find her polling booth on Thursday

content: The corridor, being developed by the Bengaluru Business Corridor Limited (BBCL), a special purpose vehicle, is designed to ease congestion by creating an access-controlled eight-lane road around the city, flanked by four-lane service roads

content: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini said that the AAP has only misled people with false promises of change¬†and has not fulfilled its promises made¬†during the 2022 Assembly polls

The idea is to make agriculture part of the green finance conversation, says T. Vivekanandhan, Lead-ESG and Sustainable, Finance, Samunnati Finance, at panel discussion at The Hindu Sustainability Summit 2025

title: BJP trying to weaken legacy of independence movement, says Ashok Gehlot
content: Gehlot said that though the BJP had got the opportunity to come to power ‚Äúin the name of religion‚Äù, that did not mean they should try to erase the legacy of Congress

title: Places of prayer turn perilous
content: The stampede at Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple in Kasibugga on November 1, is the deadliest of its kind this year, claiming nine lives. Brought about by a combination of poor judgement, social media hype and hollow safeguards, the tragedy lays bare glaring holes in crowd management at temples in Andhra Pradesh, writes Hareesh P.¬†

title: Over 59% of unrecognised political parties linked to Bihar failed to disclose finances: ADR
content: The report showed only 67 parties (24.36%) made both audit and contribution reports publicly available for 2023-24, collectively declaring an income of ‚Çπ85.56 crore, expenditure of ‚Çπ71.49 crore and donations worth ‚Çπ71.73 crore.

content: He claimed that the people now had a glimmer of hope with his one-year-old Jan Suraaj party emerging as an alternative that was viable

content: To a pointed query as to whether he could side with the BJP, Tej Pratap Yadav said, ‚ÄúI will be with anyone who removes unemployment‚Äù

content: Bihar Chief Minister appeals to the people of Bihar to ‚Äòvote with the same enthusiasm in the second phase on November 11, so that Bihar progresses further‚Äô

title: Bombay HC asks Maharashtra SEC to justify its decision not to use VVPAT in local body polls
content: Petitioner argues that not using VVPAT violates voters‚Äô right to verify their choice and undermines free and fair elections; calls for a return to ballot papers if VVPAT not deployed with EVMs

title: State to allocate 300 acres to Japanese companies: Principal Secretary
content: Japan was among the top five sources of FDI for India and Japanese firms are long-term investors in our infrastructure, clean energy and advanced manufacturing sectors, he says

title: Passengers fall prey to ‚Äòwaiting fee‚Äô auto scam in Bengaluru
content: Several users have taken to social media and lodged complaints with aggregator platforms over being unfairly charged

title: Over 1,200 Flights Cut Across US Amid Shutdown Standoff
content: More than 1,200 flights were canceled across the United States on Friday after the Trump administration ordered reductions to ease strain on air traffic controllers working without pay amid a federal government shutdown.

title: US To Boycott G20 Summit In South Africa Over Alleged Treatment Of White Farmers
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that no US government officials would be attending the Group of 20 summit this year in South Africa, citing the country's treatment of white farmers.

title: US Government Says Trump's Hush Money Conviction Should Be Thrown Out
content: The US government said President Donald Trump's hush money criminal conviction in New York should be thrown out, because it was based on improper evidence and a legal theory preempted by federal law.

title: Turkey Issues "Genocide" Arrest Warrant Against Israel's Netanyahu
content: Turkey announced Friday that it had issued arrest warrants for genocide against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and senior officials within his government.

title: Brazil Supreme Court Panel Rejects Bolsonaro's Appeal Against Jail Term
content: The majority of justices on Brazil's Supreme Court panel reviewing former President Jair Bolsonaro's appeal rejected his request on Friday.

title: "Will Remember This": Jamaica, Cuba Praise India For Support After Hurricane
content: Cuba and Jamaica have publicly thanked India for standing with them after Hurricane Melissa tore through the Caribbean, leaving widespread destruction and a rising death toll.

title: James Watson, Co-Discoverer Of DNA Double-Helix, Dies At 97
content: James D. Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died, according to his former research lab. He was 97.

title: Several Huts Burnt In Massive Slum Fire In Delhi
content: A massive fire broke out in a cluster of huts near Rithala metro station in Delhi's Rohini late on Friday night, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) said.

title: Video: Street Fight Between College Students In Bengaluru
content: The incident took place on Wednesday outside a private college on North Bengaluru's Hesaraghatta Road.

title: "Don't Send Me": Parents Say 9-Year-Old Who Jumped To Death Was Bullied In School
content: In a quiet Jaipur home, the voice of nine-year-old Amaiyra still echoes from a WhatsApp recording her mother made a year ago. In the clip, the Class 4 student can be heard sobbing: "I don't want to go to school... don't send me."

title: What Foreign Ministry Said On Trump's India Visit
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday clarified it has 'nothing' to share on US President Donald Trump's visit to India despite his recent remarks suggesting that the trip could take place next year.

title: Case Against 4 Voters For Taking Photos Of EVMs In Bihar
content: Cases were registered against four persons in Bihar for allegedly clicking photos of EVMs during voting and sharing them on social media, officials said on Friday.

title: Kidnapping Scare In Coimbatore "Simple Domestic Argument": Cops
content: The late-night panic over a suspected abduction in Coimbatore, which prompted a massive police search, has turned out to be a false alarm.

title: Synthetic Drug Cartel Busted In Tamil Nadu, 3 Foreigners Among 14 Arrested
content: The police have busted a major interstate synthetic drug cartel controlled by foreign nationals residing in Tamil Nadu, uncovering a highly sophisticated supply chain spanning multiple states.

title: Madras High Court Reserves Order TVK Leader's Plea To Cancel Case Over Post On Karur Stampede
content: The Madras High Court has reserved its orders on a petition filed by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) General Secretary Aadhav Arjuna, seeking to cancel an FIR registered against him for allegedly posting an inflammatory message on social media.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Unveils 2 Major Guwahati Landmarks Worth Rs 327 Crore
content: It's a moment of pride for Guwahati as Assam's most ambitious urban beautification initiatives - the Guwahati Gateway River Terminal and the Brahmaputra Riverfront, were inaugurated today by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Sikkim To Offer Free Cervical Cancer Vaccines To Girls Below 14 Years
content: Sikkim Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang on Friday announced that all girls below the age of 14 in the state will receive free vaccination against cervical cancer from April 2026.

title: Explained: Delhi Airport Tech Glitch That Delayed Nearly 800 Flights
content: Nearly 800 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport, India's busiest, after a major technical glitch hit its Air Traffic Control (ATC) system on Thursday evening, disrupting flight planning and causing a ripple effect across multiple airports.

title: HAL Signs Pact For 113 Jet Engines To Power Tejas Mark 1A Fleet
content: In a significant development for India's indigenous fighter jet programme, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited inked a deal with US-based General Electric for the supply of more than 100 jet engines to power the Light Combat Aircraft Tejas Mark-1A.

title: 2-Year-Old Boy Killed After Lorry Crashes Into Wall In Bengaluru
content: A two-year-old boy was killed on Friday after a cement lorry mixer crashed into a compound wall in Bengaluru.

title: HC gives split verdict on MP Abdul Rashid Sheikh‚Äôs plea on travel expenses
content: The Baramulla MP, who defeated Omar Abdullah in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, is facing trial in a terror funding case with allegations that he funded separatists and terror groups in J&K

content: On Nitish Kumar becoming the Chief Minister if the NDA won the election, Dharmendra Pradhan said the ‚Äúpost of the Chief Minister is not vacant in the NDA‚Äù

content: Due priority has been given to ensure Minimum Support Prices to various crops, he says, adding that the coalition government paid 95% of the crop insurance upon coming to power

title: Telangana bets on women to power its $1 trillion economy

title: A normal home, a unique idea: Group living initiative in Hyderabad gives special-needs persons a life of choice
content: Five community homes in northern Hyderabad are reshaping what adulthood and independence can mean for people with special needs by offering real routines, real responsibilities and real freedom, supported by caregivers and a campus that builds skills for life and work

title: MCH bogged down by patients, staff inadequacies
content: While hospital officials assert that Venu received appropriate medical attention according to established protocols, the incident highlights systemic issues, such as overcrowding and shortage of staff, at the MCH.

title: Major storm set to hit circuit
content: a major storm appears set to hit the Interlagos circuit ahead of the sprint race . forecasters predict heavy rain and high winds on Saturday morning . the worst weather is currently estimated to hit a circuit between 6 a.m. and 9 a . a delay to the race could then have an impact on the start time .

title: Wildlife panel gives nod to 13 defence projects
content:
.

National Board for Wildlife - a panel that takes decisions on projects in areas near wildlife protected zones - has given its approval to 13 defence and paramilitary projects, most in Ladakh and one in Arunachal Pradesh. Clearances have been given on conditions of following environmental safeguards and mitigation plans to protect Himalayan ecosystems. The projects include new border outposts, a brigade headquarters, ammunition storage and training facilities, and bridge work.

End of Article

title: Bike stunt by 4 youths kills Kanpur woman
content:
Representative image

KANPUR: A bike stunt by four youths on Thursday claimed the life of a 23-year-old woman on the Ganga Barrage in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh. Bhavika Gupta, the victim, had gone to the barrage with her friend on a two-wheeler on Thursday evening. Her family said she was just a few metres away from the barrage when four youths on two bikes came speeding, and one of them rammed into her scooter. Bhavika was dragged for at least 50m, her family said, adding the bikes were cruising at 110 km/hr. Bhavika died at the hospital. The youths fled leaving behind one sports bike. The vehicle bore the social media details of one Brijesh Nishad. When checked, the photo of a youth on a sports bike was found. Below the post were some comments wanting to know "whether he (Brijesh) was alive after the accident at Ganga Barrage". Police are on the look out for the accused. tnn

End of Article

title: A former Red bastion gets its first women's hospital
content: the hospital will serve as a lifeline for five southern talukas of Gadchiroli . patients earlier had to travel long distances to Chandrapur or Nagpur for advanced maternity care . the inauguration of women's hospital and newborn baby centre is aimed at strengthening maternal and child healthcare .

title: For PIL on 1950 quota order, Supreme Court raps law student: 'Focus on studies'
content: a third-year law student fumbled but regained composure to say it affects my interest . a bench led by CJI-designate Surya Kant asked when was the Presidential Order issued specifying which scheduled caste communities would get reservation? he told the students that he must research and file a proper PIL and not one like the present one .

title: Man tied to pole and set on fire by 3 in UP, critical
content:
Representative image

BAREILLY: A 22-year-old man, Mohd Mehboob, suffered severe burn injuries and is in a critical condition after three unidentified men allegedly tied him to a pole, poured petrol on him and set him on fire while he was returning from a mosque after offering Friday namaz. As the ropes got burned, he could free himself and managed to reach home. His family rushed him to the nearby community health centre, which referred him to another hospital. Mehboob‚Äôs father, Abdul Sattar, claimed his son suffered 50% burns. The family has filed a complaint, but no FIR has been registered yet. Budaun SP (Rural) Hridesh Katheria said, ‚ÄúIt seems the attackers first poured petrol on the man and set him on fire. The victim told police that he had an argument with the accused men Thursday. Three suspects have been detained for questioning.‚Äù ‚ÄúAll aspects of the case are being probed,‚Äù said SP Katheria.

End of Article

title: 18 years after acquittal, SC revives case against ex-Chhattisgarh CM's son
content: the murder of NCP's Ramavatar Jaggi took place in 2003 . it was alleged that the conspiracy was hatched at the CM's residence as his father was governing the state at that time . the case was transferred to CBI and trial court acquitted him in 2007 while convicting 20 other accused .

title: May travel to India next year, 'friend' PM Modi wants me to visit, says Trump
content: "he's a friend of mine, and we speak... He wants me to go there," he says . "i will have a great trip there with Prime Minister Modi," the president says in response to a question . the trip could happen next year, he said .

title: After 8 years on the run, man held for journo's murder
content: police arrested Gaurav Kumar, wanted for the double murder of a senior journalist . the "model worker" had been promoted from security guard to manager at a construction firm . he was taken completely by surprise when a team from police's "Proclaimed Offenders Staff" surrounded him .

title: Amid row, Ajit says Pune land deal cancelled, defends son

title: Revellers beat Haryana cop to death outside home
content: sub-inspector Ramesh Kumar, 57, tried to stop the assailants from creating a ruckus in the neighbourhood but was allegedly battered with bricks and sticks . the officer's nephew was also injured in the attack .

title: Petitioners pick SIR over EC, SC to hear on November 11
content: a bench of cJI-designate Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said it fix the hearing on Nov 11, when the petitions challenging the law on CEC/EC appointments are also listed . the challenge to the validity of CEC and other ECs (Appointment, Conditions of Officer and Terms of office) Act, 2023, can wait .

title: UK‚Äôs GCHQ shared intel with Canada implicating Delhi in Nijjar: Report
content: GCHQ handed a dossier to Ottawa of intercepted communications . it alleges the Indian government was behind various plots to kill Khalistan separatists . analysts believe the individuals having these conversations were working on behalf of the Indian govt .

title: He won the Nobel, later sold it: DNA double-helix pioneer James Watson dies at 97
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: Remove strays from hospitals, schools, bus & train stations: Supreme Court
content: stray dogs should be removed from premises of educational institutions, hospitals, sports complexes, bus stands and depots, and railway stations . a bench of justices said the "menace of dog bites" is a matter of human safety, and govts are under obligation to protect life and health of citizens .

title: India inks $1 billion deal for 113 Tejas engines
content: the delivery of 113 new GE-F404 engines to defence PSU Hindustan Aeronautics will take place in the 2027-2032 timeframe, adding to the delayed supply of 99 engines ordered under a Rs 5,375 crore deal in Aug 2021 . pending trials of astra beyond visual range air-to-air missiles and laser-guided bombs as well as their integration with the israel-origin Elta ELM-based .

title: PM attacks Congress: Key verses of Vande Mataram dropped in 1937
content: in 1937, "significant verses" of 'Vande Mataram' were dropped . the "same divisive mindset" remained a challenge to the nation . he recited all six stanzas to mark 150 years of the national song .

title: US to deny visas to people with diabetes, heart disease and other chronic illnesses
content: foreign nationals seeking to immigrate to the united states could now be denied visas and green cards . the directive significantly expands the criteria for who is deemed a potential "public charge" a cable sent by the state department instructs visa officers to flag applicants whose medical conditions could require "hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of care"
